Name: Dinitrogen oxide
Hazard statement: May cause or intensify fire; oxidizer
Rationale for classification: Oxidizing because of UNRTDG Subsidiary risks Class: 5.1 and GHS, 1st, P.58 (2.4.4.2)

Name: ozone
Hazard statement: May cause or intensify fire; oxidizer
Rationale for classification: The coefficient of oxygen equivalency (oxygen atom 1.0) times the volume percentage(100vol%) is 100, which is over 21 (the reference value of ISO-10156).

Name: Nitrogen monoxide
Hazard statement: May cause or intensify fire; oxidizer
Rationale for classification: Categoly 1 by the definition on GHS, 1st, P58 (the coefficient of oxygen equivalency is 0.3 and 100% of gas is 30, larger than 21)

Name: nitrogen dioxide
Hazard statement: May cause or intensify fire; oxidizer

Name: Carbon black
Classification: Oxidizing gases - Not applicable(Materials of animal or vegetable origin and mineral origin)

Name: N-methyldithiocarbamic acid
Rationale for classification: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

Name: chlorophenol
Classification: Oxidizing gases - Not applicable (o, m, p-)

Name: Formaldehyde
Classification: Oxidizing gases - Classification not possible (gas). Not applicable (aqueous solution)
Rationale for classification: No data available (gas). Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (aqueous solution)

Name: Arsenic acid
Rationale for classification: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition (aqueous solution)

Name: Fluorine
Classification: Oxidizing gases - Category 1 (compressed). Classification not possible (not compressed)
Rationale for classification: Classified as a powerful oxidant (ICSC (2004)). Those compressed are classified into Division 5.1 (UN#1045 (compressed gas)) by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods. Those other than compressed cannot be classified due to lack of data.

Name: Chlorine
Hazard statement: May cause or intensify fire; oxidizer

Name: chlorine trifluoride
Hazard statement: May cause or intensify fire; oxidizer
Rationale for classification: UNRTDG No. 1749, Class: 2.3, Subsidiary risks Class: 5.1; 8

Name: Chlorotrifluoroethane
Rationale for classification: Classified into Division 2.2 (UN#1983) (1-chloro-2,2,2-trifluoroethane) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).
